result.execSummary:
The defendant Amato Gore Lukojo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and school

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 07-05-2022; pay applicable surcharge.Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid during period of probation.
- Full-time work, school or a combination.
- No use of possession of firearms.
COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amato Gore Lukojo

records.addlTxt: CLERK AND ERROR: Plea and Sentencing Hearing changed from 7/1/2022 to 6/30/2022.

Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, Huber Privileges for work and school.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 5pm on 7/5/2022.
- Perform 30 hours of community service.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Complete a firearms safety course.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 7/5/2022 and pay applicable surcharge. 
- Court ordered Defendant to payall costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) to be paid during the period of probation. CASH BAIL TO APPLY.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*** Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:  : Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

Case set today for a plea and sentencing. Due to the Court bring in trial, case was rescheduled. Parties were notified of the next court date via email.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amato Gore Lukojo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant was on zoom earlier, but logged off.  Due to court congestion, Court will be unable to hear this case.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements, filed.

Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a status. Defense counsel requests case be set for plea and sentencing. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 30. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amato Gore Lukojo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Amato Gore Lukojo in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amato Gore Lukojo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
